chapter.title: SQL database installation
chapter.para: The VOSpace backend service requires a SQL database as persistence layer. At CADC (Canadian Astronomy Data Center) Sybase or PostgreSQL, at INAF-OATs MySql or MariaDB are used. This points out the high level of configurability of the service. This guide provides installation instructions for MySql and MariaDB. One of the two has to be choosen by the user. To address several security concerns in a default MariaDB installation a script is provided: mysql_secure_installation. It is recommended to run it. It will ask:
If you want change MariaDB root password
If you want remove anonymous user accounts
If you want disable root logins outside of localhost
If you want remove test databases
It is recommended to answer yes to all these options.
